description: A man lies trapped beneath a shelf of books labeled "Self-Help" that has collapsed upon him. This situation presents a sharp irony, where the source intended for improvement or aid has become the instrument of his downfall. The scene is absurd and surreal, with scattered books and a wall clock dripping, perhaps symbolizing the weight of the man's struggles or the passage of time in his predicament.  The collapse of the "Self-Help" section is a novel and notable event, especially contrasted with the stable "Art" and "History" sections.
